page.title: 02Living on the Fens
page.content: Living on the fens has advantages and disadvantages. When people live on the wide open spaces of the fens they usually have a healthier atmosphere, less traffic fumes because the wind disperses them more quicky than in the town. With reasonable sized gardens we can grow our own fresh vegatables and fruit, but in a town you have to buy them from the shops. Living in the town you are usually able to walk to the shops for your weekly shopping, we had only one shop which was a Post Office as well, this has closed now. Children who live in the country villages go to school either by bus or bicycle, this is also the transport for families, unless they have a car. Children's friends often live in the town so visiting them can be difficult especially if they have no car.
